comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Opera/9.80 (Windows NT 5.1; U; en) Presto/2.7.62 Version/11.01
Build Identifier: 1.0b1

We have several ical calendars and move events between different calendars regularly. The event will move to the new calendar ok, but is not deleted or removed from the 1st calendar.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set up 2 ical calendars
2. create an event in calendar 1
3. try and move it to calendar 2
Actual Results:  
The event moves to calendar 2 but still remains visible in calendar 2. This did not occur in version 0.9

Expected Results:  
In 0.9 the event would move  to calendar 2 and disappear from calendar 1

comments.creator: optom@highburyeye.co.nz
comments.author: optom@highburyeye.co.nz

comments.raw_text: Actually, the moved event wont disappear from the NETWORKED sunbirds for other users. The user that moves the event from one calendar to another does see the correct behaviour. Refreshing the other networked sunbirds shows the event twice, once in the original calendar and once in the calendar it was moved to. Restarting sunbird updates it correctly and the event in the old calendar will go.
comments.author: optom@highburyeye.co.nz

comments.author: ssitter@gmail.com
comments.creator: ssitter@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Do multiple users write to the same calendar file? In this case it is possible that the 1st user removes the event from calendar file. If the other users don't reload the calendar the event is still visible to them. If someone now change the calendar the event is written to the file again by them.
